name: Talc-Free Powder Blush
about: What it is:¬†A fan fave pressed powder blush, now in an upgraded talc-free formula that lasts for up to 16 hours, featuring true-color payoff with a comfortable, weightless feel...Highlighted Ingredients:¬†- Naturally-Derived and Mineral-Based Pigments: Deliver true-color payoff and ensure a high-impact effect..- Pearlescent Pigments: Blurs the look of imperfections..- Superfine, Micronized Pigments: Provide an irresistibly silky, blendable application...Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan...What Else You Need to Know: Blush lasts for up to 16 hours with a comfortable, weightless feel. Pure Pigment Blend, an innovative combination of four types of pigment, achieves high-impact, true-color payoff. Irresistibly silky, blendable formula glides on smoothly and evenly while helping to blur the look of imperfections.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.- Start application where the strongest color impact is desired; the strongest color payoff will be at the first point of brush contact to skin..- For a natural rush of color, gently buff color onto skin using sweeping circular motions with NARS #16 Blush Brush for more color payoff, or NARS Yachiyo Brush for softer color payoff (brushes sold separately)..- For a seamless pop of color, layer two shades of Blush. Start with a base color in a shade that gives a subtle color to the cheeks. Layer a brighter shade in a similar tone on the apples of the cheek, then blend edges to diffuse into base color. .- For a touch-up or additional coverage, use a stippling motion when applying Blush to press color onto skin without disrupting coverage already created..- Can't get enough? Save your NARS Talc-Free Powder Blush compact, full-size refills are available in select shades....Refill Product Instructions:..Blush pan refills are available in select shades..1. Find the hole on the bottom of the compact.2. Use a safety pin or small object to pop out the current pan of NARS Blush.3. New, magnetic pan will snap into place

reviews.review_title: New formula is not the same color
reviews.review_text: Blush is one of my biggest staples. It was time for me to repurchase my absolute favorite color Behave and this new reformulation isn't even close to the same color! Like at all! reviews.review_title: Invisible blush? Scrape the first layer off
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôve had this blush for over three years and always thought I struggled with having it appear on my skin and get any soft of pigment. I‚Äôd end up ‚Äúapplying‚Äù it on top of a layer of liquid blush, just to think I was getting any sort of payoff, because this was an expensive blush for me at the time.  I eventually caved and emailed NARS directly to see what the issue was. I didn‚Äôt think I got the wrong shade as my skin tone is a fair olive, and a Sephora employee had picked out this shade for me specifically. NARS customer support suggested I ordered the wrong shade and the product wasn‚Äôt defective. They suggested I gift the blush to a friend and purchase a new shade. They weren‚Äôt very helpful. Then I came across a video on TikTok about how these blushes are so tightly pressed into the pan that they don‚Äôt give pigment. So you had to scrape off the top layer to get the actual pigment. I was sad to damage a blush but I gave it a try and after three years of owning this blush I was FINALLY able to get it to work.  So if anyone else is having issues with this blush being invisible on your skin, just scrape the top layer off. Ridiculous that support wasn‚Äôt able to identify this manufacturer issue and suggest it.

reviews.review_title: Invisible blush? Scrape the first layer off
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôve had this blush for over three years and always thought I struggled with having it appear on my skin and get any soft of pigment. I‚Äôd end up ‚Äúapplying‚Äù it on top of a layer of liquid blush, just to think I was getting any sort of payoff, because this was an expensive blush for me at the time.  I eventually caved and emailed NARS directly to see what the issue was. I didn‚Äôt think I got the wrong shade as my skin tone is a fair olive, and a Sephora employee had picked out this shade for me specifically. NARS customer support suggested I ordered the wrong shade and the product wasn‚Äôt defective. They suggested I gift the blush to a friend and purchase a new shade. They weren‚Äôt very helpful. Then I came across a video on TikTok about how these blushes are so tightly pressed into the pan that they don‚Äôt give pigment. So you had to scrape off the top layer to get the actual pigment. I was sad to damage a blush but I gave it a try and after three years of owning this blush I was FINALLY able to get it to work.  So if anyone else is having issues with this blush being invisible on your skin, just scrape the top layer off. Ridiculous that support wasn‚Äôt able to identify this manufacturer issue and suggest it.

Then I came across a video on TikTok about how these blushes are so tightly pressed into the pan that they don‚Äôt give pigment. So you had to scrape off the top layer to get the actual pigment. I was sad to damage a blush but I gave it a try and after three years of owning this blush I was FINALLY able to get it to work.  So if anyone else is having issues with this blush being invisible on your skin, just scrape the top layer off. Ridiculous that support wasn‚Äôt able to identify this manufacturer issue and suggest it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have the original Nars shade Org*** blush and received the new formulation in exchange for my review.  Full disclosure, they didn‚Äôt inform me of whether I got the shimmer or matte formula and I cannot find any information to indicate this (maybe it was on the box I threw out), but my best guess is that this is the shimmer formula.  I like the original formula‚Äîthe shade is very light, but I have redness in my skin and prefer a light blush that enhances my cheek bones but does not overly highlight the redness. Nars original formula does that well. When I received the new formulation, I noticed two things:  1.       Different packaging: The case is now square, refillable, and the pan is smaller and deeper than the original.  2.       Different look: The new Org*** formulation (on the left in the photo) appears lighter in the pan. I could see a slight shimmer to it in the pan (more so than my original, thus why I assume it is the shimmer formula), though it was subtle.  I applied one to my left cheek and one to my right cheek. The new formulation does, in fact, have more shimmer to it on application. This works for me, because it further downplays the redness in my skin and hides imperfections. I did feel that the new formulation blended better. Sometimes the old formulation was hard to distribute, and I don‚Äôt want to feel like I‚Äôm tugging at my skin. The new formulation should last 16 hours, but I never wear makeup for that long and can‚Äôt speak to this. I do know that both sides stayed put all day.  Conclusion: Exact same shade, new formulation feels easier to blend, slightly more shimmer to it on application but still nothing too obvious‚Äîfine for any occasion. Long lasting up to about 12 hours from my experience, but it could be longer.
